elements.title: Danny Kaleikini (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Danny Kaleikini (pictured) once worked as a singing hotel busboy in Waikiki before becoming the headline entertainer at the Kahala Hilton for 28 years?

elements.title: new curriculum in Wales (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the new curriculum in Wales allows schools to set their own curricula?

elements.title: Frank Goadby (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Frank Goadby said that he served on 44 committees after his retirement from the British Army?

elements.title: supply-side progressivism (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that supply-side progressivism is a response to rising costs of housing, healthcare, and other essential goods in the United States?

elements.title: Vikki Blanche (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Vikki Blanche did not take her Neighbours audition seriously, thinking that she would not be cast so soon after graduating from school?

elements.title: a South Carolina radio station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an attempt to jazz up a South Carolina radio station did not get much response from listeners?

elements.title: Sarah Ashton-Cirillo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Sarah Ashton-Cirillo, covering the Russian invasion of Ukraine, said that Ukrainians care less about her being transgender than Americans do?

elements.title: shoshin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that shoshin is a Zen Buddhist term that means having a "beginner's mind"?
